channel.title: If...else in php?
channel.description:
hay im a bit stuck with php i would like to know how to get this to work
[code] <html> <body> <?php $var1="1"; $var2="5";
if $var1==$var2 echo"hello"; else echo"nope!";
?> </body> </html> [/code]
sorry ive just started php after html it seems very useful! also if i wanted a few of them in a row so like
this code is not correct im just typing what i sorta want [code] if 10 = 10 (then it will go on to another if statement and if it is wrong it will display something like "error!" like 3 of them in a row so if the first one is correct then it will move on to the next if and then the next if that one is correct) [/code]
any help would be appreciated.

item.title: If...else in php?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Well it shouldn’t. Get 10 without quotes. Put one and hello inside quotes.

<?php
$var = 10;
$var1 = 'one';
$var2 = 'hello';
if($var == 10) {
  echo 'You're in';
} else {
  echo 'No!';
}
if($var1 == 'one') {
  echo 'You're in!';
} else {
  echo 'No.';
}
if($var2 == 'hello') {
  echo 'You're in!';
} else {
  echo 'Nope.';
}

Read full topic

item.title: If...else in php?
item.dc:creator: @N00b1 N00b1
item.description:
@N00b1 wrote:

thanks nah im thinking of java =s
but it wont go on the the next one i would like it more like this

<?php
$var="10";
$var1="one";
$var2="hello";
if($var == 10)
if ($var1 == one)
if ($var2 == hello)
echo "your in!";
else echo "no!";
else echo "no." ;
else echo "nope";
?>

and it works =] i get this now thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: If...else in php?
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

You’re taking shitty coding from scar into php. Don’t put the numbers in quotes, unless you like strings.

if($var1 == $var2) {
  echo 'Hello';
} else {
  echo 'You fucking suck at life';
}

If you want a row of ifs, you do:

if($var == 10) {  //PUT DOUBLE EQUALS, NOT SINGLE, FOOL.
  echo 'Yea';
} elseif($var == 9) {
  echo 'So';
} elseif($var == 8) {
  echo 'Penis';
}

Read full topic

<html>
<body>
<?php

$var2="5";

if $var1==$var2 echo"hello";
else echo"nope!";

?>
</body>
</html>

sorry ive just started php after html it seems very useful!
also if i wanted a few of them in a row so like

if 10 = 10
(then it will go on to another if statement and if it is wrong it will display something like "error!" like 3 of them in a row so if the first one is correct then it will move on to the next if and then the next if that one is correct)
